entry.title: Vladimír Mandl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Vladimír Mandl (pictured) wrote the first book on space law 25 years before Sputnik 1 was launched into space?

entry.title: bankruptcy of Penn Central (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the bankruptcy of Penn Central in 1970 was the largest in American history at the time?

entry.title: Robert J. Parins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that five years after retiring as the president of the Green Bay Packers, judge Robert J. Parins ruled on a case related to American serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer?

entry.title: Lyster Sanatorium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the former Lyster Sanatorium, which was used as the setting for the horror movie Villmark Asylum, is being renovated as a hotel?

entry.title: Keith Halnan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that it is not known what happened to the 25 pregnant women who were given iodine-132 in Keith Halnan's study?

entry.title: Kingdom Rush (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the success of Kingdom Rush prompted plans to grow the video game industry of Uruguay?

entry.title: Erice van Leuven (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Erice van Leuven's brothers posted a video of her mountain biking as a 10-year-old, she received four offers of sponsorship?

entry.title: Covanta Hempstead (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Covanta Hempstead's predecessor smelled so bad that it caused nearby shoppers to vomit and its workers to strike?
